717356f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 25th Street
717356f-a.text:
The Hoffman House after it was remodelled, Broadway, at and
adjoining the S.W. corner of 25th Street.
About 1897.
F. E. Parshley, from Wurts Brothers.

717361f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 25th Street
717361f.text:
Broadway, east side, between 25th and 26th Streets, the
excavation where No. 1132 (210 Fifth Avenue) stood. The 12-
story Cross Chambers Building, going throgh to Fifth Aenue,
will be constructed on this site. To the left is shown the
rear of Cafe Martin, occupied by Delmonico's up to about 1900,
which will give way in 1912 to an office building.
The rest of the pictures in this set are filed under
Fifth Avenue.
April 21, 1902
Irving Underhill, Photographer

717355f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 25th Street (West)
717355f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, at West 25th Street, and northward.
The corner structure at the left is the world famous,
Hoffman House. To the right is the frontage extending
to West 26th Street.
Circa 1905
C7ift of W. A. Lucas, photo

717359f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 25th Street (West)
717359f.text:
91132 Broadway,Nast Siio., betueen W.25th and W.26th
Streets,Manhattan.
June 12th,1912.
Photograph bE,
Norman Wurts..

717358f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 25th Street
717358f-a.text:
Hoffman House, 1111 Broadway, at Fifth Ave., at and adjoining the
S.7. corner of 2.th Street. The oldest part of the hotel, in the cente
of the block, was opened in 1864. The hotel was enlarged by annexing
and remodelling on 24th and 25th Streets, and in 1885 the eight-story
fireproof building, adjoining the 25th Street corner, was completed and
opened. This was one of the most famous hotels of its time, and
noted especially for its bar-room, on the 24th Street side, which was
a veritable art gallery. In 1904 the old part of the hotel, facing on
Broadway, will be demolished and rebuilt. h hotel will fin1ly
close its doors in 1914, and the following year loft buildings will
Ieplace the Hoffman House and the Albemarle, in this block.
